DOCNAME: CASE OF FRANCESCO LOMBARDO v. ITALY
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection withdrawn (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of Art. 6-1;Just satisfaction not applied
TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr PERSON resides in GPE . The facts established by the Commission pursuant to LAW CARDINAL ( article CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) of the Convention are as follows ( see paragraphs CARDINAL of its report ) :

CARDINAL . The applicant served in the NORP from DATE to DATE , on which date he was invalided out of the service because he had become disabled as a result of CARDINAL illnesses - an ulcer and neoplasia .
CARDINAL . Since DATE the applicant has been in receipt of an ordinary retirement pension .

CARDINAL . On DATE he applied for an ‘ enhanced ordinary pension’ on the ground that the illnesses which had caused his disablement were ‘ due to his service’ . On DATE the applicant was examined at the GPE military hospital by ORG medico - legal board . On DATE the board concluded that the neoplasia which had caused the applicant ’s disablement was not ‘ due to his service’ .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in its decision on the applicant ’s request , ORG granted him payment at the enhanced rate for DATE , on the ground that the ulcer he suffered from was ‘ due to his service’ , but rejected that part of his application concerning the neoplasia .

CARDINAL . In a registered letter dated DATE the applicant appealed to ORG against this decision . The appeal was received by ORG on DATE and reached the competent division of that court on DATE , being registered under file no . DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked for his appeal to be given priority , by derogation from the chronological order principle usually applied . Following this request , on DATE , the registry of ORG asked ORG for the applicant ’s administrative file ; on DATE it again asked for this file to be forwarded .

CARDINAL . In a note of DATE ORG announced that it was shortly to adopt an administrative measure concerning the applicant [ - an adjustment of his pension - ] and that the file would be transmitted thereafter .

CARDINAL . The file was received by the registry of ORG on DATE . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant ’s appeal and his file were transmitted to the principal public prosecutor , who [ granting Mr PERSON ’s application of CARDINAL DATE ] on DATE decided to give the case priority .

CARDINAL . On DATE the principal public prosecutor requested the opinion of ORG medico - legal board . He received this opinion on DATE . It confirmed that the applicant ’s neoplasia was not ‘ due to his service’ .
CARDINAL . On the basis of this opinion , on DATE , the principal public prosecutor submitted his pleadings , calling for the appeal to be dismissed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again asked for his case to be given priority .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the president of the division of ORG dealing with the case arranged for a hearing to be held before that division on DATE . However , the hearing did not take place because , following a judgment of ORG ( no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) , ORG of ORG gained jurisdiction to hear the case , which was transferred to it on DATE .
CARDINAL . This division heard the case at a hearing held on DATE , at the end of which it upheld the applicant ’s appeal . The text of the judgment was deposited with the registry on DATE . ...

CARDINAL . In pursuance of the provisions of Presidential Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE , state public servants are entitled to an ‘ enhanced ordinary pension’ when their employment in the public service is terminated as a result of a disability or injury attributable to the requirements of the service .
CARDINAL . Public servants make direct contributions to the pension fund through DATE payments calculated as a fixed percentage of their wages and deducted therefrom .

CARDINAL . The nature of the disability or injury is taken into account for the purpose of deciding which scale is to be applied in calculating the amount of pension . For professional members of the armed forces these scales range from PERCENT of the figure used as the basis for the calculation of pension , i.e. the full amount of the latest remuneration received , plus certain allowances where appropriate . Consequently , the amount of the pension granted is not directly linked to the total contributions paid into the pension fund by the person concerned . "
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant informed ORG had now paid him part of the amount in issue .
